capture.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to catch a person and keep them as a prisoner
capture.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Government troops have succeeded in capturing the rebel leader.
capture.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to get control of a place or object that previously belonged to an enemy, during a war
capture.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The town was captured after a siege lasting ten days.
The Dutch fleet captured two English ships.
capture.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to catch an animal after chasing or following it
capture.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The tiger was finally captured two miles outside the village.
capture.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to succeed in recording, showing, or describing a situation or feeling, using words or pictures
capture.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: These photographs capture the essence of working-class life at the turn of the century.
The robbery was captured on police video cameras.
capture.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to get something that previously belonged to one of your competitors
capture.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: We aim to capture eight percent of the UK wine market.
Republicans captured three Senate seats from the Democrats.
capture.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to put something in a form that a computer can use
capture.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: The data is captured by an optical scanner.
capture.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to remove one of your opponentâ€™s pieces from the board in chess
capture.translation[1].definitions[0].de: when you catch someone in order to make them a prisoner
capture.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The two soldiers somehow managed to avoid capture.
capture.translation[1].definitions[1].de: when soldiers get control of a place that previously belonged to an enemy
capture.translation[1].definitions[2].de: when you get control of something that previously belonged to one of your competitors
capture.translation[1].definitions[3].de: when you put information into a form a computer can use
capture.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to get something that previously belonged to one of your competitors
capture.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: Japanese firms have captured over 60% of the electronics market.
capture.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to put something such as information or a picture into a form that a computer can use
capture.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The data is captured using an optical scanner.
